resource_dependency.customerDataSchema: Table 'customers' with fields: id (UUID), first_name (string), last_name (string), email (string), phone_number (string), address (text), date_of_birth (date), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Manage customer records through full CRUD operations including creation, reading, updating, and deletion of customer data.
static_description: A table displaying customer records with columns for name, email, phone number, and address. Above the table, there are buttons for adding new customers and search/filter inputs.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Add Customer' opens a modal form for entering new customer details. Clicking on a row enables editing mode for that record.
The customer table supports vertical scrolling when the dataset exceeds the viewport height.

resource_dependency.policyDataSchema: Table 'policies' with fields: id (UUID), customer_id (foreign key to customers.id), policy_type (string), start_date (date), end_date (date), premium_amount (decimal), status (enum: active/inactive/expired), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Enable full CRUD functionality for managing insurance policies associated with customers.
static_description: A list view showing policy cards or a tabular format with policy details such as type, duration, amount, and status. Controls above allow filtering by status or customer.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'New Policy' launches a multi-step form to create a policy linked to a customer. Clicking a policy card expands it to show detailed information and edit options.
Hovering over a policy status badge shows tooltip explaining what each status means.

resource_dependency.claimsDataSchema: Table 'claims' with fields: id (UUID), policy_id (foreign key to policies.id), claim_date (date), incident_description (text), claimed_amount (decimal), approved_amount (decimal), status (enum: submitted/approved/rejected), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Provide complete CRUD capabilities for handling insurance claims related to policies.
static_description: A claims dashboard presenting either a timeline or grid view of filed claims with key details visible. Filter controls let users sort by status or date range.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'File New Claim' opens a form requiring selection of a policy and entry of incident details. Clicking a claim entry allows viewing and updating its approval status.
Double-clicking a claim entry opens a detailed view with all claim information and history.

resource_dependency.browseInterfaceAssets: Icons for customer/policy/claim entities, filter dropdown contents predefined per entity field types

function: Allow users to navigate and inspect existing customer, policy, and claims data through intuitive browsing interfaces.
static_description: Three main navigation tabs labeled 'Customers', 'Policies', and 'Claims'. Each tab displays a respective data grid with summary views and quick access filters.

interaction_and_states.description: Switching between tabs loads the corresponding data view. Clicking column headers sorts the displayed data accordingly.
Users can select multiple rows to perform batch actions like export or bulk update.

resource_dependency.jwtTokenStorage: Client-side storage mechanism for JWT tokens after successful login

function: Implement secure authentication and role-based authorization to protect system access and operations.
static_description: A centered login form featuring username and password fields with a branded logo atop. Background uses whitesmoke color scheme with dark cyan accents on buttons and links.

interaction_and_states.description: Submitting the login form validates credentials via API call and redirects to the dashboard upon success. Logout clears session and returns to login screen.
Pressing Enter while focused in any input field triggers the login submission action.

resource_dependency.dashboardLayoutBlueprint: Grid layout definition specifying positions for KPI summaries, chart widgets, and recent activity panels

function: Present actionable insights derived from business data through an analytical dashboard interface.
static_description: Dashboard composed of modular panels showing metrics like total customers, active policies, pending claims, revenue trends, and top-performing products. Uses whitesmoke background with dark cyan borders around sections.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking refresh reloads analytics data dynamically without page reload. Clicking settings icons lets users customize which KPIs appear.
Hovering over metric values reveals tooltips indicating how they were calculated and their time period.

resource_dependency.reportTemplates: Predefined templates categorized by report types (financial, operational, compliance)

function: Generate customizable reports covering different aspects of insurance operations for stakeholders.
static_description: Report generation panel containing selectable report categories, parameter inputs (dates, departments), preview area, and generate/download buttons styled with dark cyan theme against whitesmoke backdrop.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting a report category populates relevant parameters. Clicking 'Preview' renders sample output. Clicking 'Generate Report' creates downloadable file asynchronously.
Adjusting date ranges or filters automatically updates available report formats and estimated processing times.

resource_dependency.chartingLibrary: Integration with Chart.js or similar library supporting line/bar/pie/donut charts

function: Visualize complex datasets using interactive graphical representations tailored to user preferences.
static_description: Chart containers arranged within dashboard panels showing policy trend lines, claim distribution pie charts, and revenue bar graphs. All visuals use consistent dark cyan color palette.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking legend items toggles visibility of corresponding data series. Clicking export button downloads current chart as image.
Hovering over chart segments displays contextual data labels and percentages directly on the visualization.

resource_dependency.frontendFramework: React/Vue/Angular framework setup with Axios/Fetch configured for API communication
resource_dependency.apiConfigSetup: Base URL configuration pointing to backend services running locally during development

function: Serve dynamic content exclusively sourced from backend APIs ensuring real-time data consistency.
static_description: Single-page application shell loading initial route-based views with placeholder states before data arrives. Global header includes branding and authenticated user context menu.

interaction_and_states.description: Route changes trigger async data fetching routines specific to target modules. Loading indicators appear until responses resolve.
Manual refresh initiates re-fetching of currently viewed data from respective endpoints.

resource_dependency.databaseConnectionDetails: Uses provided environment variables: DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp

function: Expose RESTful APIs enabling frontend applications to interact with persistent data stored in PostgreSQL database.
static_description: Backend service listening on configured port exposing documented API routes grouped under '/api' namespace. Logs incoming requests and errors for monitoring purposes.

interaction_and_states.description: Incoming HTTP requests are routed to appropriate controllers which query database using ORM/connection pool and return structured JSON responses.
Unhandled exceptions result in standardized error payloads being sent back to clients along with proper HTTP status codes.

function: Define relational database structure storing core business entities essential for insurance operations.
static_description: Entity relationship diagram outlining primary keys, foreign key relationships, and constraints among customers, policies, and claims tables hosted inside PostgreSQL instance.

interaction_and_states.description: Running migration scripts applies schema definitions atomically to initialize clean database state matching application expectations.

resource_dependency.searchFilterComponents: Reusable UI components for text search boxes, date pickers, dropdown selectors mapped to searchable fields

function: Empower users to locate specific records efficiently across all major data modules using flexible search criteria.
static_description: Universal search bar positioned prominently near top of every data module view. Adjacent filter dropdown menus provide advanced filtering by common attributes like dates, statuses, or ownership.

interaction_and_states.description: Typing into global search triggers debounced API queries returning filtered results matching entered keywords.
Selecting filter values narrows displayed dataset instantly through client-side or server-side filtration depending on volume.

resource_dependency.responsiveCSSFramework: Tailwind CSS or Bootstrap setup enforcing responsive breakpoints and theming guidelines

function: Ensure optimal usability and aesthetic coherence across devices maintaining specified color scheme throughout interface.
static_description: Visually consistent layouts adapting fluidly between desktop, tablet, and mobile screen sizes. Background uniformly whitesmoke with interactive elements rendered in dark cyan tones.

interaction_and_states.description: Layout adjusts responsively collapsing sidebars into hamburger menus on smaller screens and stacking content vertically where needed.

resource_dependency.concurrentDevScript: "dev": "concurrently \"npm run dev --prefix frontend\" \"npm run dev --prefix backend\""

function: Facilitate parallel local development workflow allowing simultaneous startup of frontend and backend services.
static_description: Terminal command prompt ready to execute unified development script launching both application tiers seamlessly side-by-side.

interaction_and_states.description: Executing 'npm run dev' spawns two separate processes—one serving frontend assets and another hosting backend APIs—both monitored within same terminal session.

resource_dependency.installAllScriptDefinition: "install:all": "npm install && npm run install:fe && npm run install:be"
resource_dependency.subInstallScripts: "install:fe": "cd frontend && npm install", "install:be": "cd backend && npm install"

function: Streamline dependency installation process across entire project stack minimizing manual steps required for setup.
static_description: Root-level package.json manifest listing composite installation commands alongside standard metadata entries.

interaction_and_states.description: Issuing 'npm run install:all' sequentially runs nested install procedures installing packages for root, frontend, and backend directories in order.
